revised_title: Intensities of Y Rays: Studying Compton Secondaries for Efficiency Curves
tldr: The article discusses various methods for investigating the intensities of y rays, focusing on the photo-Compton method. The authors describe a technique using a copper radiator to study the Compton secondaries and construct an efficiency curve for copper as a secondary radiator. They apply this method to the disintegrations of active isotopes Na24, Mn56, and Cl38 to determine the intensities and energies of y rays.
